title: 106_hr4226
content: The Act is titled the "Black Hills National Forest and Rocky Mountain Research Station Improvement Act." It involves the sale or exchange of land in the Black Hills National Forest in South Dakota. The Secretary of Agriculture may sell or exchange the United States' interest in approximately 362 acres of land in South Dakota, including various parcels in the Black Hills Meridian area. The Secretary of Agriculture may sell or exchange approximately 362 acres of land in South Dakota, including parcels in the Black Hills Meridian area such as Tracts BLKH-6, BLKH-7, BLKH-8, and BLKH-9, totaling around 211 acres. The Secretary of Agriculture may sell or exchange land in South Dakota, including Tracts BLKH-9 and BLKH-10, totaling approximately 21 acres and 0.39 acres respectively. Technical corrections can be made to legal descriptions, and applicable laws apply to land conveyance for National Forest System purposes. The Secretary may accept cash equalization payments exceeding 25 percent of land value in exchanges. Solicitations of offers for sale or exchange may be used, with the Secretary able to reject inadequate offers. Funds from sales or exchanges will be deposited into a designated fund. Funds from sales or exchanges exceeding 25 percent of land value shall be deposited into the fund established by Public Law 90-171 (``Sisk Act'') and available for land acquisition in South Dakota and administrative improvements in Black Hills National Forest. Authorization of appropriations is provided for necessary funding. Authorization is given for $2,100,000 to the Secretary of Agriculture for a new laboratory facility at the Rocky Mountain Research Station in Rapid City, South Dakota. The replacement facility must be located within the state boundaries and co-located with administrative improvements for the Black Hills National Forest. Acquisition of property must be from willing sellers.
